alert.note: Alert for Dickinson; Menominee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 12:26AM EDT until April 21 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Menominee River near Vulcan affecting Menominee, Dickinson and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Niagara affecting Florence, Menominee, Dickinson and Marinette Counties. Menominee River near Florence affecting Florence, Dickinson and Iron Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Michigan... Brule River near Commonwealth affecting Florence, Forest, Dickinson and Iron Counties. For the Menominee River...including Florence, Vulcan, Niagara... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Menominee River near Niagara. * WHEN...Until Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 15.5 feet, Water is covering adjacent parks in both Kingsford and Niagara. River Road in Aurora is covered with water. This stage compares to a flow of 19700 cubic feet per second. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 PM CDT Saturday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 14.5 feet Monday evening. It will then rise to 14.7 feet Tuesday evening. It will fall below flood stage late Thursday evening to 12.4 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then rise to 12.7 feet early Saturday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.1 feet on 04/27/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon.
